bio: Borderless is tech not-for-profit tech arm of Crypto Smart raising devs for free
contributionDescription:
Our last Cipher session Onboarded 20 more University Students to learn Solidity, a programming language used to develop smart contracts, and is essential for the growth and adoption of the Optimism ecosystem.

By training these 20 people to learn Solidity for free, B<>rder/ess tech hub is providing a valuable resource to the community and helping to build a stronger foundation for the future of Optimism.

Here are some specific ways that B<>rder/ess developers programme benefits the Optimism ecosystem:

Increase the number of developers building on Optimism:

The more developers who know Solidity, the more applications and protocols can be built on Optimism.

Improve the quality of smart contracts on Optimism:

Creating a diverse community with devs in different parts of the world, Africa

contributionLinks.description: Our Progress Report on Solidity Students
Eth Nigeria Meet Up at B<>rder/ess hub

impactDescription:
IMPACT

Our training has some immediate impact for the Optimism ecosystem.

For example, the 20 people who complete their training will be able to start contributing to the Optimism ecosystem right away by building new applications and protocols, or by auditing existing code.

Here are some specific ways that our students contribute to the Optimism ecosystem:

1. Build new applications and protocols on Optimism

2. Audit existing smart contracts on Optimism for security vulnerabilities.
We also teach Cyber Security at B<>rder/ess so this would help web3 devs learn faster on securing vulnerabilities.

3. Educate others about Solidity and Optimism through blog posts, tutorials, and workshops.

Keep up with our progress report here: https://twitter.com/BorderlessDev
